value.label: Dhawan made his first-class debut for Delhi against Andhra during Ranji Trophy in the year 2004.
The Ranji Trophy is a domestic first-class cricket championship played in India between teams representing regional and state cricket associations.

value.label: Dhawan made his international debut versus Australia but got out on a duck.
The Australia national cricket team is the joint oldest team in Test cricket history, having played in the first ever Test match in 1877.

value.label: Dhawan scored the most runs in the tournament and was also named as the player of the tournament.

The ICC Champions Trophy was a one day international (ODI) cricket tournament organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC), second in importance only to the Cricket World Cup. Its name was changed to the Champions Trophy in 2002.

value.label: Dhawan failed to score big runs and was dropped from the team.

The ICC T20 World Cup (earlier known as ICC World Twenty20) is the international championship of Twenty20 International cricket. The tournament currently consists of 16 teams, comprising the top eight teams from the rankings at the given deadline and four other teams chosen through the T20 World Cup Qualifier.

value.label: Dhawan finished the 2015 world cup as the fifth-highest run scorer.
The 2015 ICC Cricket World Cup was the 11th Cricket World Cup, jointly hosted by Australia and New Zealand.

value.label: Shikhar Dhawan played for the Delhi Daredevils in the Indian Premier League until he was traded to the Mumbai Indians in 2009 in exchange for Ashish Nehra.
The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

value.label: Dhawan is the first Indian batsman to score a century before lunch on the first day of a Test match.

image.altText: Dhawan is the first Indian batsman to score a century before lunch on the first day of a Test match.

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
Domestic Ranji trophy cricket team based in Delhi
An yearly award by the Wisden Cricketers' Almanack
